newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish May CPI 0.6 pct m/m, 14.6 pct yr/yr -finmin.
newsitem.headline: Polish May CPI 0.6 pct m/m, 14.6 pct yr/yr -finmin.

text.p: Polish inflation was 0.6 percent month on month and 14.6 percent year-on-year in May and a further significant fall in year-on-year inflation was expected in June, Finance Minister Marek Belka said on Monday.

"Today I have received information that inflation in May was 0.6 percent and 14.6 percent year-on-year and I am almost sure that there will be a further significant fall in year-on-year inflation in June," Belka told reporters before a government meeting.
Belka, asked whether the government would revise down its official year-end target of 13 percent, said:
Monthly consumer price inflation in April was 1.0 percent and year-on-year inflation 15.3 percent, down from 18.5 at the end of 1996.
The Central Statistical Office (GUS) was due to release full official inflation data for May later on Monday.
